intro: Nemopanthus mucronatus f. chrysocarpus, commonly known as the golden fruit wintergreen, is a rare and striking variant of the wintergreen plant. It is characterized by its bright yellow fruits, which contrast vividly with its dark green foliage. The plant belongs to the Ericaceae family and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique coloration and rarity, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
